trans-unit.source: Visual Layer
trans-unit.target: Visual Layer

trans-unit.source: The Windows.UI.Composition API gives you access to the composition layer between the framework layer (XAML), and the graphics layer (DirectX).
trans-unit.target: The Windows.UI.Composition API gives you access to the composition layer between the framework layer (XAML), and the graphics layer (DirectX).

trans-unit.source: Visual Layer
trans-unit.target: Visual Layer

trans-unit.source: \[ Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.
trans-unit.target: \[ Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.

trans-unit.source: For Windows 8.x articles, see the [archive](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?linkid=619132) \]
trans-unit.target: For Windows 8.x articles, see the [archive](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?linkid=619132) \]

trans-unit.source: In Windows 10, significant work was done to create a new unified compositor and rendering engine for all Windows applications, be it desktop or mobile.
trans-unit.target: In Windows 10, significant work was done to create a new unified compositor and rendering engine for all Windows applications, be it desktop or mobile.

trans-unit.source: A result of that work was the unified Composition WinRT API called Windows.UI.Composition that offers access to new lightweight Composition objects along with new Compositor driven Animations and Effects.
trans-unit.target: A result of that work was the unified Composition WinRT API called Windows.UI.Composition that offers access to new lightweight Composition objects along with new Compositor driven Animations and Effects.

trans-unit.source: Windows.UI.Composition is a declarative, [Retained-Mode](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/desktop/ff684178.aspx) API that can be called from any Universal Windows Platform (UWP) Application to create composition objects, animations and effects directly in an application.
trans-unit.target: Windows.UI.Composition is a declarative, [Retained-Mode](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/desktop/ff684178.aspx) API that can be called from any Universal Windows Platform (UWP) Application to create composition objects, animations and effects directly in an application.

trans-unit.source: The API is a powerful supplement to existing frameworks such as XAML to give developers of UWP applications a familiar C# surface to add to their application.
trans-unit.target: The API is a powerful supplement to existing frameworks such as XAML to give developers of UWP applications a familiar C# surface to add to their application.

trans-unit.source: These APIs can be used to create DX style framework-less applications.
trans-unit.target: These APIs can be used to create DX style framework-less applications.

trans-unit.source: A XAML developer can “drop down” to the composition layer in C# to do custom work in the composition layer using WinRT to create a “Composition Island” of objects in their XAML application rather than dropping all the way down to the graphics layer and using DirectX and C++ for any custom UI work.
trans-unit.target: A XAML developer can “drop down” to the composition layer in C# to do custom work in the composition layer using WinRT to create a “Composition Island” of objects in their XAML application rather than dropping all the way down to the graphics layer and using DirectX and C++ for any custom UI work.

trans-unit.source: Composition Objects and The Compositor
trans-unit.target: Composition Objects and The Compositor

trans-unit.source: Composition objects are created by the [**Compositor**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/Dn706789) which acts as a factory for composition objects.
trans-unit.target: Composition objects are created by the [**Compositor**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/Dn706789) which acts as a factory for composition objects.

trans-unit.source: The compositor can create [**Visual**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/Dn706858) objects, which allow for the creation of a visual tree structure on which all other features and Composition objects in the API use and build on.
trans-unit.target: The compositor can create [**Visual**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/Dn706858) objects, which allow for the creation of a visual tree structure on which all other features and Composition objects in the API use and build on.

trans-unit.source: The API allows developers to define and create one or many [**Visual**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/Dn706858) objects each representing a single node in a Visual tree.
trans-unit.target: The API allows developers to define and create one or many [**Visual**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/Dn706858) objects each representing a single node in a Visual tree.

trans-unit.source: Visuals can be containers for other Visuals or can host content Visuals.
trans-unit.target: Visuals can be containers for other Visuals or can host content Visuals.

trans-unit.source: The API allows for ease of use by providing a clear set of [**Visual**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/Dn706858) objects for specific tasks that exist in a hierarchy:
trans-unit.target: The API allows for ease of use by providing a clear set of [**Visual**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/Dn706858) objects for specific tasks that exist in a hierarchy:

trans-unit.source: [**Visual**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/Dn706858) – The base object.
trans-unit.target: [**Visual**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/Dn706858) – The base object.

trans-unit.source: The majority of the properties are here, and inherited by the other Visual objects.
trans-unit.target: The majority of the properties are here, and inherited by the other Visual objects.

trans-unit.source: [**ContainerVisual**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/Dn706810) – Derives from [**Visual**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/Dn706858), and adds the ability to insert child visuals.
trans-unit.target: [**ContainerVisual**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/Dn706810) – Derives from [**Visual**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/Dn706858), and adds the ability to insert child visuals.

trans-unit.source: [**SpriteVisual**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/Mt589433) – Derives from [**ContainerVisual**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/Dn706810), and contains content in the form of images, effects, and swapchains.
trans-unit.target: [**SpriteVisual**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/Mt589433) – Derives from [**ContainerVisual**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/Dn706810), and contains content in the form of images, effects, and swapchains.

trans-unit.source: [**Compositor**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/Dn706789) – The object factory that manages the relationship between an application and the system compositor process.
trans-unit.target: [**Compositor**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/Dn706789) – The object factory that manages the relationship between an application and the system compositor process.

trans-unit.source: The compositor is also a factory for a number of other composition objects used to clip or transform visuals in the tree as well as a rich set of animations and effects.
trans-unit.target: The compositor is also a factory for a number of other composition objects used to clip or transform visuals in the tree as well as a rich set of animations and effects.

trans-unit.source: Effects System
trans-unit.target: Effects System

trans-unit.source: Windows.UI.Composition supports real time effects that can be animated, customized and chained.
trans-unit.target: Windows.UI.Composition supports real time effects that can be animated, customized and chained.

trans-unit.source: Effects include 2D affine transforms, arithmetic composites, blends, color source, composite, contrast, exposure, grayscale, gamma transfer, hue rotate, invert, saturate, sepia, temperature and tint.
trans-unit.target: Effects include 2D affine transforms, arithmetic composites, blends, color source, composite, contrast, exposure, grayscale, gamma transfer, hue rotate, invert, saturate, sepia, temperature and tint.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see the [Composition Effects](composition-effects.md) overview.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see the [Composition Effects](composition-effects.md) overview.

trans-unit.source: Animation System
trans-unit.target: Animation System

trans-unit.source: Windows.UI.Composition contains an expressive, framework agnostic animation system that allows you to set up two types of Animations: key frame animations and expression animations.
trans-unit.target: Windows.UI.Composition contains an expressive, framework agnostic animation system that allows you to set up two types of Animations: key frame animations and expression animations.

trans-unit.source: These are used to move visual objects, drive a transform or a clip, or animate an effect.
trans-unit.target: These are used to move visual objects, drive a transform or a clip, or animate an effect.

trans-unit.source: By running directly in the compositor process, this ensures smoothness and scale, letting you run large numbers of concurrent, unique animations.
trans-unit.target: By running directly in the compositor process, this ensures smoothness and scale, letting you run large numbers of concurrent, unique animations.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see the [Composition animations](composition-animation.md) overview.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see the [Composition animations](composition-animation.md) overview.

trans-unit.source: XAML Interoperation
trans-unit.target: XAML Interoperation

trans-unit.source: In addition to creating a visual tree from scratch, the Composition API can interoperate with an existing XAML UI using the [**ElementCompositionPreview**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/Mt608976) class in [**Windows.UI.Xaml.Hosting**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/Hh701908).
trans-unit.target: In addition to creating a visual tree from scratch, the Composition API can interoperate with an existing XAML UI using the [**ElementCompositionPreview**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/Mt608976) class in [**Windows.UI.Xaml.Hosting**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/Hh701908).

trans-unit.source: Note
trans-unit.target: Note

trans-unit.source: This article is for Windows 10 developers writing Universal Windows Platform (UWP) apps.
trans-unit.target: This article is for Windows 10 developers writing Universal Windows Platform (UWP) apps.

trans-unit.source: If you’re developing for Windows 8.x or Windows Phone 8.x, see the [archived documentation](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?linkid=619132).
trans-unit.target: If you’re developing for Windows 8.x or Windows Phone 8.x, see the [archived documentation](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?linkid=619132).

trans-unit.target: Composition samples in the [Composition GitHub](https://github.com/Microsoft/composition).
